{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question is about the action of Erythropoietin. Erythropoietin is a hormone that stimulates red blood cell production. It acts on early stages of erythropoiesis, specifically on stem cells or precursors of red blood cells. CFU stands for Colony-Forming Units, which are stem cells that can give rise to mature red blood cells. Therefore, Erythropoietin acts on CFU.", "answer_choice": "A"}
